title: Bug 18934: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
OB:
Build F2 (20020602)
Redhat 7.2, GTK2
KDE 2.10(GTK2 only)
Open the ImageAnalyzer example. Notice the scrollbars are enabled, and you can move them around, but they don't have any effect. If you open a small image, like an icon, the scrollbars are just misleading because they don't do anything.
EB: The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example should be disabled when handling small images like icons, ensuring they accurately reflect the image size and do not mislead users.
SR:
1. Launch the application with the provided build and environment (Build F2, Redhat 7.2, GTK2, KDE 2.10).
2. Open the ImageAnalyzer example.
3. Observe the enabled scrollbars.
4. Attempt to interact with the scrollbars.
5. Open a small image, such as an icon.
6. Notice the lack of effect from the scrollbars, highlighting their misleading behavior.
